wikipedia_page.main: Paul Christopher Maynard (born 16 December 1975) is a British Conservative Party politician. He was elected at the 2010 general election as the Member of Parliament (MP) for Blackpool North and Cleveleys. Maynard served as Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State for the Department for Transport from 2016 to 2018 and again from 2019 to 2020.

response: Network Rail was scheduled to install an extra lift giving access to the Northern Line platforms in 2016/17. No work had begun by the end of 2016; the Transport Minister, Paul Maynard, confirmed that owing to funding issues, work would not start until 2019 at the earliest.

response: * Paul Maynard, Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State for Department for Transport since 2019 (cerebral palsy)

link_mentions.page: Blackpool North and Cleveleys (UK Parliament constituency)
response: Blackpool North and Cleveleys is a constituency represented in the House of Commons of the UK Parliament since 2010 by Paul Maynard, a Conservative.

The village is part of the borough of Blackpool, and generally considered a suburb of the town. To the south of Bispham is Warbreck, North Shore and Layton, to the east is Carleton and to the north is Norbreck and Thornton Cleveleys and to the west, the Irish Sea. The area is mostly urban. Bispham was formerly in the Blackpool North and Fleetwood parliamentary constituency, but, as of the 2010 general election forms part of the Blackpool North and Cleveleys constituency whose M.P. is Paul Maynard.
*Paul Maynard, Conservative Party Member of Parliament for Blackpool North and Cleveleys

link_mentions.page: Records of members of parliament of the United Kingdom
response: Paul Maynard, MP for Blackpool North and Cleveleys since 2010, who has cerebral palsy and a congenital speech defect.
*Paul Maynard; MP for Blackpool North and Cleveleys (2010–present)
